resources.string: This app is meant to be as simple as possible to use … hence, to search for a Māori word/phrase, please enter it WITHOUT macrons, i.e. just type in \"a\u00A0e\u00A0i\u00A0o\u00A0u\" instead of \"ā\u00A0ē\u00A0ī\u00A0ō\u00A0ū\" … you will be shown all variants anyway, IF that word/phrase exists here

The built-in FUZZY LOGIC feature has 3 options. Exact Match is self-explanatory … Fuzzy Logic by itself shows SOME words beginning OR ending with the word/phrase you entered, whereas Extra Fuzzy shows ALL words containing your search word/phrase ANYWHERE in the selected language, again IF those words are here in the database
The BROWSE ALL button shows both ENTIRE lists of Māori to English and English to Māori translations & allows you to \"flip\" between the two
Pressing the RANDOM button will show 5 words (chosen at random) from the selected language

You can filter the search results if there are more than 12 listings. If your device has a soft keyboard, tap the area that says Filter results. If you have a hardware keyboard, just start typing. Another feature is the saving of your Search preferences for next time; and the third is AutoComplete history.
Your search preferences are saved for use next time you start the app
Your search history is saved for use next time you start the app. After typing a few letters, a popup menu will show under the Textbox if there are relevant suggestions from previous searches

You can easily bookmark favourite words for later viewing. To add a word as a new favourite, simply long-press the listing and choose that option. You can access all your favourites in one place by tapping the Māori flag on the \"home\" page. To remove a favourite from that list, long-press the word, and choose the appropriate option
You can choose to Share a word via Email, Facebook, Text or whatever. Just choose that option from the same pop-up menu. Options vary according to the apps you have installed on your device
To easily view most of the colours in either Maori or English, just click the Colours icon on the \"home\" page.
To easily view most of the numbers in either Maori or English, just click the Numbers icon on the \"home\" page.

Note that the left-arrow on the title bar is actually a home button, so be aware that this will return you directly to the \"home\" page, bypassing any other screen you may have been viewing in the meantime
